caller_intent: The caller sought clarification on whether the Handyman Class Code covers incidental roofing repair replacement for a new business venture involving limited metal roof repairs.
resolution_steps: Agent asked for details about the frequency and scope of the roofing repairs.
Caller provided context: 2-3 repairs/year on metal roofs as part of renovations/add-ons.
Agent confirmed that incidental patching under the Handyman Code is acceptable for the described activity.
Agent emphasized that major repairs/replacements would require a different classification.
knowledge_required: Understanding of insurance class codes (specifically Handyman Code)
Ability to assess business operations for code applicability
Knowledge of incidental vs. major repair classifications
summary: An Alliance Insurance agent clarified that the Handyman Class Code covers incidental metal roof repairs for a new business, provided the work is limited to 2-3 annual repairs as part of renovations. The agent confirmed this after discussing the client's business model and repair scope, ensuring proper code application to avoid future quoting issues.
